004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PS4Controller;
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
011
012/**
013 * A version of {@link PS4Controller} with {@link Trigger} factories for command-based.
014 *
015 * @see PS4Controller
016 */
017@SuppressWarnings("MethodName")
018public class CommandPS4Controller extends CommandGenericHID {
019  private final PS4Controller m_hid;
020
021  /**
022   * Construct an instance of a device.
023   *
024   * @param port The port index on the Driver Station that the device is plugged into.
025   */
026  public CommandPS4Controller(int port) {
027    super(port);
028    m_hid = new PS4Controller(port);
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Get the underlying GenericHID object.
033   *
034   * @return the wrapped GenericHID object
035   */
036  @Override
037  public GenericHID getHID() {
038    return m_hid;
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Constructs an event instance around the L2 button's digital signal.
043   *
044   * @return an event instance representing the L2 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
045   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
046   */
047  public Trigger L2() {
048    return L2(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Constructs an event instance around the L2 button's digital signal.
053   *
054   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
055   * @return an event instance representing the L2 button's digital signal attached to the given
056   *     loop.
057   */
058  public Trigger L2(EventLoop loop) {
059    return m_hid.L2(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Constructs an event instance around the R2 button's digital signal.
064   *
065   * @return an event instance representing the R2 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
066   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
067   */
068  public Trigger R2() {
069    return R2(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Constructs an event instance around the R2 button's digital signal.
074   *
075   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
076   * @return an event instance representing the R2 button's digital signal attached to the given
077   *     loop.
078   */
079  public Trigger R2(EventLoop loop) {
080    return m_hid.R2(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Constructs an event instance around the L1 button's digital signal.
085   *
086   * @return an event instance representing the L1 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
087   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
088   */
089  public Trigger L1() {
090    return L1(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Constructs an event instance around the L1 button's digital signal.
095   *
096   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
097   * @return an event instance representing the L1 button's digital signal attached to the given
098   *     loop.
099   */
100  public Trigger L1(EventLoop loop) {
101    return m_hid.L1(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Constructs an event instance around the R1 button's digital signal.
106   *
107   * @return an event instance representing the R1 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
108   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
109   */
110  public Trigger R1() {
111    return R1(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
112  }
113
114  /**
115   * Constructs an event instance around the R1 button's digital signal.
116   *
117   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
118   * @return an event instance representing the R1 button's digital signal attached to the given
119   *     loop.
120   */
121  public Trigger R1(EventLoop loop) {
122    return m_hid.R1(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Constructs an event instance around the L3 button's digital signal.
127   *
128   * @return an event instance representing the L3 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
129   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
130   */
131  public Trigger L3() {
132    return L3(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Constructs an event instance around the L3 button's digital signal.
137   *
138   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
139   * @return an event instance representing the L3 button's digital signal attached to the given
140   *     loop.
141   */
142  public Trigger L3(EventLoop loop) {
143    return m_hid.L3(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Constructs an event instance around the R3 button's digital signal.
148   *
149   * @return an event instance representing the R3 button's digital signal attached to the {@link
150   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
151   */
152  public Trigger R3() {
153    return R3(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Constructs an event instance around the R3 button's digital signal.
158   *
159   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
160   * @return an event instance representing the R3 button's digital signal attached to the given
161   *     loop.
162   */
163  public Trigger R3(EventLoop loop) {
164    return m_hid.R3(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
165  }
166
167  /**
168   * Constructs an event instance around the square button's digital signal.
169   *
170   * @return an event instance representing the square button's digital signal attached to the
171   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
172   */
173  public Trigger square() {
174    return square(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Constructs an event instance around the square button's digital signal.
179   *
180   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
181   * @return an event instance representing the square button's digital signal attached to the given
182   *     loop.
183   */
184  public Trigger square(EventLoop loop) {
185    return m_hid.square(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * Constructs an event instance around the cross button's digital signal.
190   *
191   * @return an event instance representing the cross button's digital signal attached to the {@link
192   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
193   */
194  public Trigger cross() {
195    return cross(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
196  }
197
198  /**
199   * Constructs an event instance around the cross button's digital signal.
200   *
201   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
202   * @return an event instance representing the cross button's digital signal attached to the given
203   *     loop.
204   */
205  public Trigger cross(EventLoop loop) {
206    return m_hid.cross(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
207  }
208
209  /**
210   * Constructs an event instance around the circle button's digital signal.
211   *
212   * @return an event instance representing the circle button's digital signal attached to the
213   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
214   */
215  public Trigger circle() {
216    return circle(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
217  }
218
219  /**
220   * Constructs an event instance around the circle button's digital signal.
221   *
222   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
223   * @return an event instance representing the circle button's digital signal attached to the given
224   *     loop.
225   */
226  public Trigger circle(EventLoop loop) {
227    return m_hid.circle(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
228  }
229
230  /**
231   * Constructs an event instance around the share button's digital signal.
232   *
233   * @return an event instance representing the share button's digital signal attached to the {@link
234   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
235   */
236  public Trigger share() {
237    return share(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
238  }
239
240  /**
241   * Constructs an event instance around the share button's digital signal.
242   *
243   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
244   * @return an event instance representing the share button's digital signal attached to the given
245   *     loop.
246   */
247  public Trigger share(EventLoop loop) {
248    return m_hid.share(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Constructs an event instance around the PS button's digital signal.
253   *
254   * @return an event instance representing the PS button's digital signal attached to the {@link
255   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
256   */
257  public Trigger PS() {
258    return PS(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
259  }
260
261  /**
262   * Constructs an event instance around the PS button's digital signal.
263   *
264   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
265   * @return an event instance representing the PS button's digital signal attached to the given
266   *     loop.
267   */
268  public Trigger PS(EventLoop loop) {
269    return m_hid.PS(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Constructs an event instance around the options button's digital signal.
274   *
275   * @return an event instance representing the options button's digital signal attached to the
276   *     {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
277   */
278  public Trigger options() {
279    return options(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Constructs an event instance around the options button's digital signal.
284   *
285   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
286   * @return an event instance representing the options button's digital signal attached to the
287   *     given loop.
288   */
289  public Trigger options(EventLoop loop) {
290    return m_hid.options(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
291  }
292
293  /**
294   * Constructs an event instance around the touchpad's digital signal.
295   *
296   * @return an event instance representing the touchpad's digital signal attached to the {@link
297   *     CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
298   */
299  public Trigger touchpad() {
300    return touchpad(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop());
301  }
302
303  /**
304   * Constructs an event instance around the touchpad's digital signal.
305   *
306   * @param loop the event loop instance to attach the event to.
307   * @return an event instance representing the touchpad's digital signal attached to the given
308   *     loop.
309   */
310  public Trigger touchpad(EventLoop loop) {
311    return m_hid.touchpad(loop).castTo(Trigger::new);
312  }
313
314  /**
315   * Get the X axis value of left side of the controller.
316   *
317   * @return the axis value.
318   */
319  public double getLeftX() {
320    return m_hid.getLeftX();
321  }
322
323  /**
324   * Get the X axis value of right side of the controller.
325   *
326   * @return the axis value.
327   */
328  public double getRightX() {
329    return m_hid.getRightX();
330  }
331
332  /**
333   * Get the Y axis value of left side of the controller.
334   *
335   * @return the axis value.
336   */
337  public double getLeftY() {
338    return m_hid.getLeftY();
339  }
340
341  /**
342   * Get the Y axis value of right side of the controller.
343   *
344   * @return the axis value.
345   */
346  public double getRightY() {
347    return m_hid.getRightY();
348  }
349
350  /**
351   * Get the L2 axis value of the controller. Note that this axis is bound to the range of [0, 1] as
352   * opposed to the usual [-1, 1].
353   *
354   * @return the axis value.
355   */
356  public double getL2Axis() {
357    return m_hid.getL2Axis();
358  }
359
360  /**
361   * Get the R2 axis value of the controller. Note that this axis is bound to the range of [0, 1] as
362   * opposed to the usual [-1, 1].
363   *
364   * @return the axis value.
365   */
366  public double getR2Axis() {
367    return m_hid.getR2Axis();
368  }
369}
